page.title: 13Employment
page.content: Forestry In the 1920's the Forestry Commission was set up to produce timber after a big loss during the First World War.Planting in the Kidland Forest commenced a lot later, probably in the 1940's.At one time there were about twelve employed by them in this forest and their base was beside Woodhall.The industry inthis area has been run down over the last few years. There is no-one local employed in the forests now. Any work is carried out by men from Rothbury.When the local office was closed down in 1983, there was a Forester and 5 men employed. Main species of trees planted were Sidka Spruce,Norway Spruce,Lodgepole,Contorta and Scot's Pine.
